benchmark_details.name: ALiiCE (Automatic LLMs’ Positional Fine-grained Citation Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: ALiiCE is the first automatic evaluation framework for positional fine-grained citation generation, utilizing a dependency tree based approach to parse sentence-level claims into atomic claims and evaluate citation quality using three metrics: positional fine-grained citation recall, precision, and coefficient of variation of citation positions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the positional fine-grained citation generation performance of large language models and demonstrate the effectiveness of the ALiiCE framework.

data.source: ASQA (Ambiguous QA) and ELI5 (Explain Like I’m Five) datasets
data.size: 948 queries for ASQA, 1,000 examples for ELI5

metrics: Coefficient of Variation of Citation Positions (CVCP)
methodology.calculation: Metrics are derived based on the performance of large language models in generating positional fine-grained citations in long-form QA responses.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values of citation recall and precision indicate better citation quality, and CVCP measures the dispersion of citation positions within sentences.
methodology.validation: Evaluation is validated through experiments comparing various language models.
